panels.description:
Number of under-replicated partitions (| ISR | < | all replicas |). Alert if value is greater than 0.
Normal value 0.
panels.title: UnderReplicatedPartitions

panels.description: Number of partitions that donâ€™t have an active leader and are hence not writable or readable. Alert if value is greater than 0.
panels.title: OfflinePartitionsCount

panels.description:
Number of partitions whose in-sync replicas count is less than minIsr.
Normal value 0.
panels.title: UnderMinIsrPartitionCount

panels.description: Normal value 0
panels.title: AtMinIsrPartitionCount

panels.description: Byte in rate from clients
panels.title: BytesInPerMin Per Topic

panels.description: Byte in rate from clients
panels.title: Total BytesInPerMin

panels.description: Byte out rate to clients
panels.title: BytesOutPerMin Per Topic

panels.description: Byte out rate to clients
panels.title: Total BytesOutPerMin

panels.description: Message in rate
panels.title: MessagesInPerMin Per Topic

panels.description: Byte out rate to clients
panels.title: Total MessagesInPerMin

panels.description: Request rate
panels.title: RequestsPerMin Per Request

panels.description: Byte out rate to clients
panels.title: Total RequestsPerMin

panels.description: Fetch request rate
panels.title: TotalFetchRequestsPerMin

panels.description: Produce request rate
panels.title: TotalProduceRequestsPerMin

panels.description: Fetch request rate for requests that failed.
panels.title: FailedFetchRequestsPerMin

panels.description: Produce request rate for requests that failed.
panels.title: FailedProduceRequestsPerMin

panels.description:
Leader election rate and latency.
non-zero when there are broker failures.
panels.title: LeaderElectionRateAndTimeMs

panels.description:
Unclean leader election rate.
Normal value 0.
panels.title: UncleanLeaderElectionsPerSec

panels.description: Number of partitions on this broker. This should be mostly even across all brokers.
panels.title: PartitionCount

panels.description: Number of leaders on this broker. This should be mostly even across all brokers. If not, set auto.leader.rebalance.enable to true on all brokers in the cluster.
panels.title: LeaderCount

panels.description:
Maximum lag in messages between the follower and leader replicas. This is controlled by the replica.lag.max.messages config.
lag should be proportional to the maximum batch size of a produce request.
panels.title: MaxLag

panels.description: If a broker goes down, ISR for some of the partitions will shrink. When that broker is up again, ISR will be expanded once the replicas are fully caught up. Other than that, the expected value for both ISR shrink rate and expansion rate is 0.
panels.title: IsrShrinksPerSec

panels.description: When a broker is brought up after a failure, it starts catching up by reading from the leader. Once it is caught up, it gets added back to the ISR.
panels.title: IsrExpandsPerSec

panels.description: Size of the request queue. A congested request queue will not be able to process incoming or outgoing requests.
panels.title: RequestQueueSize

panels.description:
Total time in ms to serve the specified request
broken into queue, local, remote and response send time
panels.title: AVG TotalTimeMs

panels.description: Time the request waits in the request queue
panels.title: AvgPerMin RequestQueueTimeMs

panels.description: Time the request is processed at the leader
panels.title: AvgPerMin LocalTimeMs

panels.description: Time the request waits for the follower. This is non-zero for produce requests when acks=all
panels.title: AvgPerMin RemoteTimeMs

panels.description: Time the request waits in the response queue
panels.title: AvgPerMin ResponseQueueTimeMs

panels.description: Time to send the response
panels.title: AvgPerMin ResponseSendTimeMs

panels.description: Lag in number of messages per follower replica. This is useful to know if the replica is slow or has stopped replicating from the leader.
panels.title: FetcherLagMetrics

panels.description: Number of requests waiting in the producer purgatory. This should be non-zero when acks=all is used on the producer.
panels.title: Producer PurgatorySize

panels.description: Number of requests waiting in the fetch purgatory. This is high if consumers use a large value for fetch.wait.max.ms
panels.title: Fetcher PurgatorySize
